# Papers, Presentations, and Projects

* [Signs of the Sine Illusion - Why We Need to Care](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/heike/sine-illusion/master/Revision2/SineIllusion-Rearrange.pdf) (accepted to JCGS in October 2014)

* The Curse of Three Dimensions: Why Your Brain is Lying to You
    * [2014 ASA Student Paper Competition](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/srvanderplas/LieFactorSine/master/GraphicsPaperCompetition/Full%20Paper%20Unblinded.pdf) Version - won the Graphics Section Student Paper Award at JSM 2014. 
    
    * [Presentation](Presentations/WhyYourBrainIsLyingToYou/JSM2014.html) - The presentation (with some additional text) given at JSM 2014
    
    * [Expanded Paper](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/srvanderplas/LieFactorSine/master/AcmTransactions/PsychLieFactor.pdf) - This version is expanded and contains an additional case study with corresponding implications. It is in preparation for submission to ACM Transactions on Applied Perception, and should be complete by December 2014. 


* [Visual Aptitude and Statistical Graphics](https://github.com/srvanderplas/VisualAptitude) - This paper explores the visual reasoning abilities necessary for good performance on statistical lineup tasks. It is a work in progress, but should be ready for publication in December 2014. 

* [Animint](https://github.com/tdhock/animint) - My Google Summer of Code project in 2013. I served as a mentor for the project in 2014. 
    * [Animint Paper](https://github.com/tdhock/animint-paper)
    * [Animint presentation](Presentations/Animint/animint.html) - given at the Great Plains R User group in May 2014.

* Presentation: [User Testing Panel, JSM 2014](Presentations/UserTestingJSM2014/UserTesting.html) - Slides from a panel on usability testing of statistical graphics.


# Personal Projects
* [Exploring Personal Ads in Online Classifieds](Projects/Classified/Analysis.html) - This analysis is still in progress; I began it to explore text mining and classification algorithms (and chose the topic because of its potential for amusement). 

* [2012 Election Visualization](https://dicook.github.io/election2012/index.html) - I worked with Dianne Cook, Andee Kaplan, and Eric Hare to visualize data from the 2012 presidential election. I focused on analyzing political contributions, campaign spending, and voting technology.
